name: The Jamaica Pegasus Hotel

reviews.text: Big and good hotel, 5 star quality. Really good pool. Tasty and great breakfast buffet, with a good selection of local dishes, as well as eggs, cheeses, breads, cereal and fruits. Free wireless internet. Good restaurants for lunch and dinner.
reviews.title: GReat

reviews.text: Wonderful hotel, amenities and staff. Buffet Breakfast is absolutely fabulous...local fare as well as the expected omlette station, cereals, etc. I would stay here again just for the food! Kids enjoyed the pool - it is large and certainly uncrowded.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: This is a nice hotel with great amenities. I used the gym quite a bit and enjoyed the food and drinks in the hotel restaurants. It's better than the American owned chains in the area. It's my preferred hotel to stay in when I am working in Kingston. Internet in the rooms was somewhat unreliable but the lobby always works and allows you to people-watch.
reviews.title: Great local hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the Pegasus July 16-22. Check in was fine. I was allowed to check in early in the morning. They gave me a renovated room on the 5th floor. I was the first person to use the renovated room. In the last week of my stay they actually added a picture on the wall and a chair to the room. The room came equipped with a 42 inch flat screen TV on the wall, a refrigerator and a safe.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but some problems

reviews.text: Pros: The breakfast was delicious with real jamaican dishes. The view was wonderful and front desk was pleasant
reviews.title: Not the type of property they aspire to be

reviews.text: Stayed for almost a week for business in Kingston. Warm, friendly staff - all very helpful. Clean, spacious rooms with nice little touches like great views, free internet, bath salts and turndown service. The food was EXCELLENT. Loved the 24x7 Cafe and breakfast buffet at the Country Kitchen which was open air to the pool and gardens. The Columbus restaurant was a delight and I had what quite possibly was the best meal ever - you must try the Pumpkin soup and Shrimp casserole! I appreciated the late hours for the Business Centre, traditional afternoon tea with live music, fantastic coffee and the beautifully landscaped grounds. A lovely hotel and a tremendous value - much better than expected, plus the most reasonable rates in the city.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT place to stay! Great value for the price.

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Pegasus a few times. And always in a standard. Actual rooms are quite dated, old fashioned tea/coffee station with kettle in each room. TV is very 80's style with several US channels of differing reception. Sockets/electricity supply in Jamaica is the normal British system (240 volts, 3 pin plugs) so British travellers will be at home, as no adaptors to worry about. For Non-Brits, its a different story..so bring an adaptor/convertor.
reviews.title: Dated, but ok

reviews.text: Staff are quite formal and not very interested in any form of conversation, but I think thats more to do with the Jamican psyche of being quite reserved until they know you. Housekeeping staff seem the friendliest, and rooms are cleaned everyday with lots of offers of extra towels and ice..if you don't want to be disturbed by this, keep your Do Not Disturb sign on.
reviews.title: Excellent Service with Courtesy

reviews.text: I have always got free wifi, VERY hit and miss, works ok on the balcony..if you have one!! If not then the pool/bar/reception is the best areas. Be warned none of the wifi access is secured! Pool area is also great, lots of beds, small fitness room, running track and tennis courts, with a resident tennis pro. Yes some of the public area s are frequented by prostitutes and drug sellers..but they are no hassle really!
reviews.title: Don't Believe The Hype

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food outlets ok, if you like American food, burgers/sandwiches etc..only one Jamaican dish on any menu, Jerk Chicken! There is also normally one Jamaican dish at the breakfast buffet as well, food prices in pool bar/coffee shop are normal UK prices, so British/European Union visitors won't have any price shocks! But for US visitors it could prove expensive. And service can be quite slow..island time and all that. All prices are quoted in Jamican Dollars (Approx. JM$115.00 to £1.00), but your final bill at reception will be in US$
reviews.title: Nice hotel, not safe area

reviews.text: I stayed in the Pegasus for a week in November 2008.
reviews.title: Decent

reviews.text: Its location is quite central in the business district in Kingston.
reviews.title: OK; Not Impressive

reviews.text: There is a park opposite the hotel which may not be too safe at night. There is a jogging trail within the hotel premises which is secure.
reviews.title: Mixing Business with Pleasure....

reviews.text: The outside of the hotel is well kept but I was a bit dissaponted at the room. The rooms are decent, but not as good as one would expect.
reviews.title: An expensive oasis

reviews.text: The staff were nice but the constant knocking to check whether I needed towels was a bit annoying.
reviews.title: Best of Kingston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I went to the Pegasus so we could be near the stadium for the Boys & Girls Champs and because he was familiar with this hotel. Overall the hotel was fine, the room was updated and clean (though the carpet did have a bit of a humid smell which the cleaning staff cleaned up). The bathroom is small but clean. It was a little weird getting in and out of the tub since its pretty high off the floor. We had the view of the pool and tennis courts so it was quiet for us. And with the darkening drapes it was cozy to sleep in. The room was also cool enough that we didn't even sleep with the AC on. The carpet in the hallway should definitely be either removed or changed cause its showing some serious wear and tear.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel w/ Nice People

reviews.text: Didn't use the pool but my boyfriend said it looked very clean and he used the gym which he said was adequate. We had the Sunday brunch which my boyfriend had very high expectations for having had it in previous occasions and was a bit disappointed with it. I thought it was OK, definitely had better authentic Jamaican food elsewhere.
reviews.title: Pretentious, over priced and over rated
It depends on what you want
reviews.text: All in all, if we are ever in Kingston again, we will most definitely be staying here again.

Not my cup of tea at all. Rooms were average, floors were regimented and bar prices were downright extortionate. The Pegasus considers itself to be something that it isn't. Nice pool, busy gym, cafeteria breakfast. There are better places in Kingston.
reviews.title: Ok hotel and facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in Peg in January. Hotel was a bit run down (guess that is the standard in Kingston?). Poolside was quiet. Went to Hilton a few times for drinks and for dinners (nice poolside, lively and busy). Wanted to move to HIlton but didnt cos of bad writeups in Tripadvisor and also their rate was 50% more than Peg. Bfast in Peg was nothing to shout about (dont they every change the menu?). Gym was pathetic - most of the equipment was not working properly and place was deserted - I was alone all the time I used the gym (compared to Hilton which was busy). Sigh.
reviews.title: I LOVED THE ROOM

description: The Pegasus rises 17 stories in the heart of the business and financial district. It is within walking distance of international offices, embassies and shopping areas. The hotel is located 25 minutes from the Norman Manley International Airport. Our all-suite Royal Club floors are specially designed for business executives, and amenities include private check-in and check-out, complimentary continental breakfast and cocktails in the private lounge and a private fitness room.
